articles.description: Pop legend Elton John has called off his summer tour dates citing fears that large gatherings 'risk accelerating the spread of the coronavirus'
articles.content:
Elton John has cancelled his upcoming summer tour due to the coronavirus outbreak. 
The pop legend, 73,  has called off his US shows which had been run to from may until July.
He had already axed a number of dates on the Goodbye Yellow Brick Road tour for t… [+1740 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: National Theatre 'haemorrhaging money', says Rufus Norris - The Stage
articles.description: Norris said the NT has been operating "with great difficulty" since it closed to the public last month
articles.content:
National Theatre director Rufus Norris has warned that the organisation is “haemorrhaging money” while it is forced to remain closed, arguing that the industry may need aggressive government support if it is to survive the coronavirus crisis.

articles.title: From Will & Grace to Sex and the City, why do so many TV reboots lead to our favourite ensemble casts hating each other? - The Independent
articles.description: As the revival of ‘Will & Grace’ comes to a close amid allegations of cast feuds and bullying, Adam White asks why so many of our favourite shows seem to implode when they’re brought back to life
articles.content: In January, the Willl & Grace actor Megan Mullally, best known for her role as acid-tongued boozehound Karen Walker on the long-running sitcom, alleged that she was being bullied at work. Ive had a recent situation that I cant be specific about, she said … [+9476 chars]
